item.title: language exchange with Akiko
item.description: 00:06 Friday 21 June 2019 JST Today was the second time for Akiko and I to do a language exchange. She had some good ideas for Marble Track 3 and how to market it. I may end up creating another Instagram account; that is apparently the way to go these days. So happy to get another subscriber on Youtube, and enthralling to see her enthralled with the process of animating the construction!

item.title: great fear and great meeting
item.description: 09:17 Friday 07 June 2019 JST Had a great meeting this morning where I was able to express my fear and feelings of inadequacy about being a leader. Next steps, I will: Ask men “who do you want to sit in circle with you?” send English version to Zumi write my experience online send Doodle regarding next meeting time contact 3 men to invite

item.title: more plans for work
item.description: 12:11 Friday 05 October 2018 JST I am glad the lesson worked well for you; I hope everyone else enjoyed it! Thank you for the notes and letting me know it went well. Unless there are any big problems, let's continue this style. I think in Part 1 we should just have one question, or have everyone choose one question, like Zumi nearly did. Next week I will ask you to think of the question, so please think about one to ask.

item.title: mt3: moving chopstick
item.description: 13:53 Tuesday 17 April 2018 JST I did only about 56 minutes of MT3 today before I glued a piece and had to pause. item.description: 09:56 Wednesday 24 January 2018 JST ãŠã¨ã¨ã„ãŸãã•ã‚“é›ªãµãŸã€‚ It snowed a lot the other day. ï¼ˆæ¬¡ã®ï¼‰æœã«ã€ãŸãã•ã‚“å†™çœŸã‚’å–ã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ The next morning I took a lot of pictures. ç§ãŒå†™çœŸã‚’å–ã£ã¦ã‚‹æ™‚ã€ã¿ã‚“ãªã¯é›ªã‹ãã§æƒé™¤å§‹ã¾ã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ While I was taking pictures, people started shoveling snow. éš£äººã®ä½¿ã‚ãªã„é›ªã‹ãã‚’å€Ÿã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ I borrowed my neighbor’s unused shovel. æƒé™¤ã—ãªãŒã‚‰è©±ã—ã¦æ¥½ã—ã‚“ã§ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ We enjoyed chatting while cleaning up. å¤ªé™½ã¯æš–ã‹ã£ãŸã‹ã‚‰æƒé™¤ã¯ç°¡å˜ã§ã—ãŸã€‚ The sun was warm so cleanup was easy. ä½•ã§ç°¡å˜ãªã®ã¯é›ªãŒæº¶ã‘ã¦ã‚‹ã‹ã‚‰ã€‚ It was easy because the snow was melting. ã—ã‹ã—ã€æ˜¨æ—¥é§…ã¾ã é›ªã‚’æƒé™¤ã—ãªã‹ãŸæ‰€ãŸãã•ã‚“ã‚ãŸã€‚ Walking to the station the next day, I saw lots of not yet cleaned areas.
